I have never been prejudice, and I never will be. But I have to say this one thing. Immigrants are putting a strain on the economy. And not just any immigrants, but Spanish people. Where I live there are a lot of Spanish immigrants here. And they crowd the place, increase crime, and drain on the resources. I have no problem with so many being over here, if the government would just find a way for the Spanish immigrants and the citizens to both benefit. 
 
 Right now I only see it going one way, and that is:"Hook up the Spanish with whatever they need, but the citizens can fend for themselves." Something needs to be done for the benefit of all parties, not only one group of people.emoticon_mad emoticon_confused

post_info.post_title: Putting A Strain On The Economy!!

But your brother married a Chilean girl, right ? 
 
 well, Latins are in the USA on their own free will, they were not brought in like your people in chains.
 
 Miami is a better place because of the Cubans
 
 Why don't you go to New Orleans and help your bros, big mama? emoticon_xbye

 Right now I only see it going one way, and that is:"Hook up the Spanish with whatever they need, but the citizens can fend for themselves." Something needs to be done for the benefit of all parties, not only one group of people.emoticon_mad emoticon_confused
Since there are not that many immigrants from Spain coming into the US, I assume you mean Latinos. You really should refer to the people you have contempt for by the proper term. Calling a Latin American "Spanish" is most often taken as an insult. Calling them Spanish isn't respectful, as you might think, anymore than the term "Negro" is respectful compared to that other "N" word.
